1.text: These also are proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

2.text: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing; but the glory of kings is to search out a matter.

3.text: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

4.text: Take away the dross from the silver, and there cometh forth a vessel for the refiner;

5.text: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

6.text: Glorify not thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men;

7.text: For better is it that it be said unto thee: ‘Come up hither’, than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince, whom thine eyes have seen.

8.text: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

9.text: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour, but reveal not the secret of another;

10.text: Lest he that heareth it revile thee, and thine infamy turn not away.

11.text: A word fitly spoken Is like apples of gold in settings of silver.

12.text: As an ear-ring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, So is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

13.text: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, So is a faithful messenger to him that sendeth him; For he refresheth the soul of his master.

14.text: As vapours and wind without rain, So is he that boasteth himself of a false gift.

15.text: By long forbearing is a ruler persuaded, And a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

16.text: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, Lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

17.text: Let thy foot be seldom in thy neighbour’s house; Lest he be sated with thee, and hate thee.

18.text: As a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow, So is a man that beareth false witness against his neighbour.

19.text: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble Is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

20.text: As one that taketh off a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, So is he that singeth songs to a heavy heart.

21.text: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat, And if he be thirsty, give him water to drink;

22.text: For thou wilt heap coals of fire upon his head, And the LORD will reward thee.

23.text: The north wind bringeth forth rain, And a backbiting tongue an angry countenance.

24.text: It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, Than in a house in common with a contentious woman.

25.text: As cold waters to a faint soul, So is good news from a far country.

26.text: As a troubled fountain, and a corrupted spring, So is a righteous man that giveth way before the wicked.

27.text: It is not good to eat much honey; So for men to search out their own glory is not glory.

28.text: Like a city broken down and without a wall, So is he whose spirit is without restraint.
